intro: Dalea capitata var. pseudohospes, commonly known as the plains false honewort, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its clustered, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
